availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert G. Potter (Clay County, Kentucky, captain)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Barton Potter and Elizabeth A. Potter. Married to Nancy C. Gilbert Potter in Clay County on October 17, 1865. Resident of Clay County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Merchant in Clay County in 1860. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and captain from July 31, 1862, to July 21, 1864. Resigned on account of disability on July 21, 1864.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film 001904623.
